text.p: A Reuters survey of analysts covering Finnish equities showed a 848 million markka median forecast for chemicals group Kemira Oy's 1996 full-year profit before extraordinary items and tax:
(Profit forecasts by 15 analysts, EPS by 13 analysts)
Kemira's results are due on February 17 at 1100/0900 GMT.
In 1995, Kemira had a 718 million markka profit before extraordinary items and tax.
For the company's full-year 1997 profit, ten of the 15 analysts polled gave a median forecast of 1.12 billion markka (mean 1.13 billion) in a 1.04-1.26 billion markka range.

Contributors to the survey were Alfred Berg, AG Private Bankers, Aros Securities, Aktia Bank, Carnegie, Den Danske Bank, Enskilda Securities, Erik Selin, Evli Securities, FIM Securities, Handelsbanken, Interbank, Merita Securities, Opstock and Postipankki.
